meanings.definition: Remove punctuation from (a piece of writing)
meanings.sent1: She decided to unpunctuate her essay to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: I need to unpunctuate this paragraph before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to unpunctuate their sentences as a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: His writing style is like a stream of consciousness, almost as if he wants to unpunctuate reality.
meanings.sent5: The lack of punctuation in the poem served to unpunctuate the emotions of the speaker.

meanings.sent1: He will unpunctuate the document before printing it out.
meanings.sent2: The editor's job is to unpunctuate the text for a cleaner look.
meanings.sent3: In a world of emojis and acronyms, it's refreshing to unpunctuate a message.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to unpunctuate itself when she was lost in thought.
meanings.sent5: The artist chose to unpunctuate the painting to create a sense of freedom and movement.
